transportAdvice: Asheville has a limited local bus network that covers some tourist areas, but a car is highly recommended for exploring the surrounding Blue Ridge Mountains and many attractions. Downtown Asheville is walkable, and taxis as well as ride-hail services are generally available in the city center.

weather.description: Cold winter month with occasional snow or ice, especially at higher elevations around the city.
Still cold with possible snow flurries, though days can occasionally warm up pleasantly.
Early spring brings variable temperatures and increasing rainfall as the mountains begin to green up.
Mild and pleasant with blooming wildflowers and dogwoods, though showers are common.
Warm and lush with frequent afternoon showers; one of the most scenic months in the Blue Ridge.
Warm summer weather with high humidity and frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
The hottest month, with regular afternoon thunderstorms and muggy conditions.
Hot and humid with continued afternoon thunderstorm activity throughout the month.
Early fall brings cooler, more comfortable temperatures and the beginning of stunning foliage color.
Peak fall foliage month with crisp air and spectacular mountain colors; very popular with visitors.
Cooling rapidly with bare trees by month's end and the possibility of early frost or light snow.
Cold winter conditions return with occasional snow and festive holiday atmosphere in the city.
